00025 #include <FdoStd.h>
00026 #include <fdo/Commands/Network/INetwork.h>
00027 #include <fdo/Commands/PropertyValueCollection.h>
00028 
00029 /// \brief
00030 /// FdoINetworkReachableNodesCommand subclasses from FdoINetworkCommand and is the interface 
00031 /// that defines the FDO network reachable nodes analysis feature. An instance can be created through 
00032 /// the FdoIConnection::CreateCommand method. Not all FDO providers will support this command. 
00033 /// The FdoICommandCapability should be used to verify if a given provider support this command.
00034 /// \note
00035 /// This Help topic is provided for informational use only. There is
00036 /// no interface or support provided. Autodesk reserves the right to change
00037 /// the software related to the content herein.
00038 class FdoINetworkReachableNodesCommand : public FdoINetworkCommand
00039 {
00040 
00041 public:
00042     
00043     /// \brief
00044     /// This method is used to set the starting point of the network analysis. The starting 
00045     /// network feature must be set before the command is executed.
00046     /// 
00047     /// \param className 
00048     /// is the class name of the start feature. This is used in combination with the 
00049     /// feat id to find the feature instance where the analysis should start.
00050     /// \param featId 
00051     /// is a collection of the identity property values.
00052     /// 
00053     /// \return
00054     /// Returns nothing
00055     /// 
00056     FDO_API virtual void SetStartNetworkFeature(GisString* className, FdoPropertyValueCollection *featId ) = 0;
00057 };
00058 #endif
